Posts.Content: Decatur wrote: I WAS DIAGNOSED ON 12/3/07 WITH STAGE I BREAST CANCER (TUMOR SIZE .9 CM).  I HAD A LUMPECTOMY WITH SENTINEL LYMPH NODE DISSECTION ON 12/20/07.  ON 1/3/08 I FOUND OUT MY LYMPH NODE WAS POSITIVE.  AFTER TWO SURGERY DELAYS DUE TO AN ILL SURGEON, MY AUXILLARY LYMPH NODE DISSECTION WAS PERFORMED ON 1/31/08.  ON 2/4/08 I FOUND OUT THAT THEY REMOVED 11 MORE LYMPH NODES AND ALL WERE NEGATIVE.  SINCE THEN I HAVE BEEN MEETING WITH MY MEDICAL ONCOLOGIST.  HE RECOMMENDED 4 TREATMENTS OF AC, FOLLOWED BY 4 TREATMENTS OF TAXOL, EVERY TWO WEEKS.  PRETTY STANDARD.  I WAS SUPPOSED TO START CHEMO 2/23/08, BUT BECAUSE MY DRAIN DID NOT COME OUT UNTIL 2/26/08, IT HAS BEEN POSTPONED UNTIL 3/1/08.  ON 2/12/08 I HAD A CAT SCAN AND A BONE SCAN, HE WANTED A BASELINE.  THE CAT SCAN SHOWED AREAS OF CONCERN ON MY LIVER SO I HAD AN ULTRASOUND ON 2/25/08.  THAT SHOWED AREAS OF CONCERN SO ON 2/27/08 I HAD A MRI.  TODAY I FOUND OUT THERE IS A .5mm SPOT ON MY LIVER THAT THEY WANT CHECKED OUT MORE SO I AM HAVING A PET SCAN TOMORROW.  HAS ANYBODY ELSE HAD ALL THESE TESTS?  I WILL BEGIN CHEMO ON 3/1/08.  I THOUGHT THE PURPOSE OF CHEMO WAS A SYSTEMATIC TREATMENT TO ATTACK AREAS OUTSIDE OF THE INITIAL BREAST CANCER.  I FEEL I'M GETTING THE BEST CARE, AT A BREAST CANCER INSTITUTION, BUT I HAVE NEVER HEARD OF ANYBODY HAVING ALL THESE TESTS! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: TOO MANY TESTS! Decatur crgeorge36

Posts.Content: Mar 13, 2008 10:02AM Decatur wrote: It's Decatur again! The afternoon of my PET scan I found out my liver was clear.  Whew!  Of course they said there would be more follow-ups after chemo (which I started March 1).  It sounds like these tests are pretty normal from what you are all saying.  Thank you so much for your encouragement!  I am just glad I finally passed a test!  Good luck to ALL of us!
Posts.Title: TOO MANY TESTS! Decatur crgeorge36

Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2008 04:23PM Decatur wrote: Thanks for the encouragement, Gina and wishiwere.  I just joined this program today and this was my first chat.  So glad I joined!
